title: Benchmarks can cause segfaults in jemalloc
body:
```
extern crate test;
use test::Bencher;

#[bench]
fn bench(_b: &mut Bencher) { }
```

Compile with `--test` and run with `--bench`. Normally it works fine, but if started with `JE_MALLOC_CONF=quarantine:16000000` (which is how it is run under valgrind) it segfaults.

valgrind reports

```
==1568== Memcheck, a memory error detector
==1568== Copyright (C) 2002-2013, and GNU GPL'd, by Julian Seward et al.
==1568== Using Valgrind-3.10.0 and LibVEX; rerun with -h for copyright info
==1568== Command: ./segfault --bench
==1568== 

running 1 test
==1568== Invalid read of size 4
==1568==    at 0x524A294: pthread_mutex_lock (in /lib64/libpthread-2.18.so)
==1568==    by 0x232125: je_arena_dalloc_small (in /tmp/segfault)
==1568==    by 0x24CB77: je_quarantine (in /tmp/segfault)
==1568==    by 0x22AB3B: je_sdallocx (in /tmp/segfault)
==1568==    by 0x17400F: stats::_$BP$$x27a$x20$x5bT$x5d.Stats$LT$T$GT$::sum::h8477424961251279897 (in /tmp/segfault)
==1568==    by 0x173BF9: stats::Summary$LT$T$GT$::new::h12702900968401119120 (in /tmp/segfault)
==1568==    by 0x172F9B: Bencher::auto_bench::hef28bff4c3299131y1c (in /tmp/segfault)
==1568==    by 0x1436DE: run_test::ha677b01194b7e996RJc (in /tmp/segfault)
==1568==    by 0x12F6F4: run_tests_console::h58b61ec98b0884d96qc (in /tmp/segfault)
==1568==    by 0x12A7BD: test_main::haf81a121edd66bd67nb (in /tmp/segfault)
==1568==    by 0x1352F1: test_main_static::h212eab64944c9156vrb (in /tmp/segfault)
==1568==    by 0x12910F: __test::main::hab242f97b584913evaa (in /tmp/segfault)
==1568==  Address 0x10 is not stack'd, malloc'd or (recently) free'd
==1568== 
==1568== 
==1568== HEAP SUMMARY:
==1568==     in use at exit: 56,032 bytes in 387 blocks
==1568==   total heap usage: 1,423 allocs, 1,036 frees, 526,268 bytes allocated
==1568== 
==1568== LEAK SUMMARY:
==1568==    definitely lost: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==1568==    indirectly lost: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==1568==      possibly lost: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==1568==    still reachable: 56,032 bytes in 387 blocks
==1568==         suppressed: 0 bytes in 0 blocks

==1568==

Segmentation fault
```
